qas.question: How did Microsoft modify the architecture of the 360 to reduce failure rates?

answers.text: a reduction in the number, size, and placement of components

qas.question: What was the root cause of hardware failures with the 360?
When the newer 360 S models have their power buttons flash red, it means?
How does the 360 S then react to an overheating situation?

answers.text: imminent system shutdown until the system has cooled

qas.question: How did Microsoft attempt to deal with potential heat-related expansion with GPU and CPU components?

answers.text: dabs of epoxy on the corners and edges

qas.question: The second what was removed because of heating issues?
Which two quadrants light up on the Xbox 360 S to indicate overheating?
The third and first quadrant turn what two colors?

plausible_answers.text: the corners and edges of the CPU and GPU

qas.question: Where was extra epoxy placed on the models before the S?

plausible_answers.text: the three-year extended coverage for "General Hardware Failures"

qas.question: What warranty does the 360 S include?

context: Since these problems surfaced, Microsoft has attempted to modify the console to improve its reliability. Modifications include <a0_0>a reduction in the number, size, and placement of components<a0_0/>, the addition of <a4_0>dabs of epoxy on <b8_0>the corners and edges<a4_0/> of the CPU and GPU<b8_0/> as glue to prevent movement relative to the board during <a1_0>heat<a1_0/> expansion, and a second <b5_0>GPU heatsink<b5_0/> to dissipate more heat. With the release of the redesigned Xbox 360 S, the warranty for the newer models does not include <b9_0>the three-year extended coverage for "General Hardware Failures"<b9_0/>. The newer Xbox 360 S model indicates <a2_0>system overheating<a2_0/> when the console's power button begins to flash red, unlike previous models where the <b6_0>first and third quadrant<b6_0/> of the ring would light up red around the power button if overheating occurred. The system will then warn the user of <a3_0>imminent system shutdown until the system has cooled<a3_0/>, whereas a flashing power button that alternates between <b7_0>green and red<b7_0/> is an indication of a "General Hardware Failure" unlike older models where three of the quadrants would light up red.
